channel.title: Django Round-Up
channel.itunes:subtitle: A podcast by about the Django web framework, Python, and web development
channel.itunes:author: Lincoln Loop
channel.itunes:summary: This is a podcast hosted by Kenneth Love and Brandon Konkle from Lincoln Loop that highlights recent articles and projects in the Django community. We love talking about web development, so our podcast focuses on casual conversations as we cover the latest blog posts and project releases.
channel.description: This is a podcast hosted by Kenneth Love and Brandon Konkle from Lincoln Loop that highlights recent articles and projects in the Django community. We love talking about web development, so our podcast focuses on casual conversations as we cover the latest blog posts and project releases.

item.title: Flamewars as a Service
item.itunes:author: Lincoln Loop
item.itunes:summary:
Our guest this week is Buddy Lindsey, host of GoDjango videos, works at ConsumerAffairs.com.

item.title: Not a Fan of Django
item.itunes:author: Lincoln Loop
item.itunes:summary: Hynek Schlawack presents us with some Django criticism while talking with us about static media, test speed, mezzanine theming, a pypi wrapper, logging, markdown docs, interceptors, admin styling, pycon keynotes, and test servers.
item.description: Hynek Schlawack presents us with some Django criticism while talking with us about static media, test speed, mezzanine theming, a pypi wrapper, logging, markdown docs, interceptors, admin styling, pycon keynotes, and test servers.

item.title: Ecoscope
item.itunes:author: Lincoln Loop
item.itunes:summary: Brett Cannon joins us to talk about PyTenessee, performance, cookiecutter, flask foundation, scaling, raw sql migrations, code review, waffling, sockets, pixel tracking, and even cooking.
item.description: Brett Cannon joins us to talk about PyTenessee, performance, cookiecutter, flask foundation, scaling, raw sql migrations, code review, waffling, sockets, pixel tracking, and even cooking.

item.title: Guilt Trip
item.itunes:author: Lincoln Loop
item.itunes:summary: Eric Holscher jumps in to talk about blogging, deployment, the latest community news and project releases, teaching kids to code, and his experiment to support his community contributions through gittip.
item.description: Eric Holscher jumps in to talk about blogging, deployment, the latest community news and project releases, teaching kids to code, and his experiment to support his community contributions through gittip.

item.title: Brilliant or Insane?
item.itunes:author: Lincoln Loop
item.itunes:summary: This week, Kenneth and Brandon are joined by Bryan Veloso. We talk about the several official Django announcements last week, when maintainability should be sacrificed for performance, algorithmic wedding seating, promises (or futures) in concurrent programming, the Django Pony, and more!
item.description: This week, Kenneth and Brandon are joined by Bryan Veloso. We talk about the several official Django announcements last week, when maintainability should be sacrificed for performance, algorithmic wedding seating, promises (or futures) in concurrent programming, the Django Pony, and more!

item.title: Django Round-Up #10
item.itunes:author: Lincoln Loop
item.itunes:summary: This week we're joined by Portia Burton! We discuss Portland, Mozilla Persona, making a game board, migrations and South's frozen ORM, Bee Ware and GUI tools vs. the command line, clever comprehensions, and a whole lot more.
item.description: This week we're joined by Portia Burton! We discuss Portland, Mozilla Persona, making a game board, migrations and South's frozen ORM, Bee Ware and GUI tools vs. the command line, clever comprehensions, and a whole lot more.

item.title: Django Round-Up #9
item.itunes:author: Lincoln Loop
item.itunes:summary: Miguel Grinberg joins us for a very Python and Flask centered episode where we discuss color themes, video processing, web scraping, class-based views, and learning Flask.
item.description: Miguel Grinberg joins us for a very Python and Flask centered episode where we discuss color themes, video processing, web scraping, class-based views, and learning Flask.

item.title: Django Round-Up #8
item.itunes:author: Lincoln Loop
item.itunes:summary: Lynn Root joins us to discuss the latest Django and Python links, running your own young coders class, and PRISMs effect on us and the technology we use.
item.description: Lynn Root joins us to discuss the latest Django and Python links, running your own young coders class, and PRISMs effect on us and the technology we use.

item.title: Django Round-Up: DjangoCon Edition
item.itunes:author: Lincoln Loop
item.itunes:summary: In this special episode, we interview Steve Holden and discuss the history of DjangoCon, what goes into producing a conference, and Steve's personal history with Django.
item.description: In this special episode, we interview Steve Holden and discuss the history of DjangoCon, what goes into producing a conference, and Steve's personal history with Django.

item.title: Django Round-Up #7
item.itunes:author: Lincoln Loop
item.itunes:summary: This week Kenneth and Brandon are joined by Julia Elman!
item.description: This week Kenneth and Brandon are joined by Julia Elman!

item.title: Django Round-Up #2
item.itunes:author: Lincoln Loop
item.itunes:summary: This week Kenneth is joined by Katie Cunningham, aka @kcunning, who wrote a book on accessibility, and is working on a "learn python in 24 hours" book.
item.description: This week Kenneth is joined by Katie Cunningham, aka @kcunning, who wrote a book on accessibility, and is working on a "learn python in 24 hours" book.

item.title: Django Round-Up #1
item.itunes:author: Lincoln Loop
item.itunes:summary: For our first official podcast, we were joined by Daniel Greenfeld!
